title: Create a Git repository
content:
If you don't have a Git server account, you can create a local Git repository. Operations Orchestration (OO) Workflow Designer includes a batch file for creating this repository: git-create-repo.bat.

  1. Double-click the git-create-repo.bat file in the <installation path>/bin folder.
  2. In the command line dialog box, enter the path to an existing folder on the current machine or on a network location, where you want to create the repository. For example: \\xxx.net\shared\GIT\GitRepo. If the repository is on a shared file system, make sure that the user for whom the OO Workflow Designer server will run has read and write permission for this file system.

  3. You are now prompted to enter a name for the new repository to create under the path you provided earlier.

    Add any name. You don't need to add the suffix ".git" to the name, as its added by the tool.

    The repository name shouldn't contain characters that are forbidden by Windows or Linux, for example, *, <, >, orÂ % and shouldn't begin and end with white spaces.

  4. The URL of the newly created Git repository displays. Make a note of this URL, and press any key to close the command line dialog box.

    The URL should be in the following format: file://<path>/<repo>.git
